maml:description.maml:para: Get Alerts Information
Get-AzAlert cmdlet gets fired alert instances.
Unique Identifier of Alert / ResourceId of alert.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter on Alert Rule Id
Supported format - <start-time>/<end-time> where time is in ISO-8601 format
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Include context (custom payload) of alert
Include EgressConfig
Filter on Monitor Condition
Filter on Monitor Service
Number of alerts to be fetched in a page.
Project the required fields out of essentials. Expected input is comma-separated.
Filter on Severity of alert
Filter all the alerts having the Smart Group Id
Alert property to use while sorting
Sort Order
Filter on State of alert
Filter on Resource group name of the target resource of alert.
Filter on Resource type of the target resource of alert.
Supported time range values - 1h, 1d, 7d, 30d (Default is 1d)

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all alerts with Sev2 severity and Fired monitor condition. Setting IncludeContext to true, include custom payload of alert. Use Format-List to get the complete details of each alert in list.
Get Alert details by Id (GUID) or Resource Id (Complete ARM Id)

maml:description.maml:para: Create or update an alert processing rule.
Set-AzAlertProcessingRule creates or updates an alert processing rule.
Action Group Ids which are to be notified, Comma separated list of values Required only if alert processing rule type is AddActionGroups.
Alert Processing rule Type. Allowed values: AddActionGroups, RemoveAllActionGroups.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Description of Alert Processing Rule
Indicate if the given alert processing rule is enabled or disabled (default is enabled). Allowed values: False, True.
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Contains:smartgroups

Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Equals:/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId/resourceGroups/abvarma/providers/microsoft.insights/metricAlerts/test-mrmc-vm-abvarma
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Equals:ARM Name Test1,ARM Name Test2
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Contains:Test Alert
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. NotEquals:Resolved
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Equals:Platform,Log Analytics
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} severity: one of <Sev0, Sev1, Sev2, Sev3, Sev4>. For eg. Equals:Sev0,Sev1
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Equals:Metric
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Equals:mySQLDataBaseName
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. NotEquals:/subscriptions/<subscriptionID>/resourceGroups/test
Expected format - {<operation>:<comma separated list of values>} operation: one of <Equals, NotEquals, Contains, DoesNotContain> For eg. Contains:Virtual Machines,Storage Account
Alert Processing Rule Name
Resource Group Name
End Date Time. Format 2022-09-21 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
List of recurrence pattern values Expected format For a monthly recurrence type. comma separated list of values For eg. 1,3,12
List of recurrence pattern values Expected format For a weekly recurrence type. comma separated list of values For eg. Monday,Saturday
Reccurence Start Time in the timezone of ScheduleTimeZone parameter. Format 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
Reccurence Start Time in the timezone of ScheduleTimeZone parameter. Format 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
Specifies when the processing rule should be applied. Allowed values: Daily, Monthly, Weekly.
List of recurrence pattern values Expected format For a monthly recurrence type. comma separated list of values For eg. 1,3,12
List of recurrence pattern values Expected format For a weekly recurrence type. comma separated list of values For eg. Monday,Saturday
Reccurence Start Time in the timezone of ScheduleTimeZone parameter. Format 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
Reccurence Start Time in the timezone of ScheduleTimeZone parameter. Format 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
Specifies when the processing rule should be applied. Allowed values: Daily, Monthly, Weekly.
Start Date Time. Format 2022-09-21 06:00:00 Should be mentioned in case of Reccurent Schedule - Daily, Weekly or Monthly.
Schedule time zone. Default: UTC.
List of resource IDs, Comma separated list of values The rule will apply to alerts that fired on resources within that scope
Alert Processing rule tags. For eg. @{"tag1" = "key1";"tag2" = "key2"} Use {} to clear existing tags.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-AzAlertProcessingRule -ResourceGroupName "test-rg" -Name "AddActionGroupToSubscription" -Scope "/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId" -Description "Add ActionGroup1 to all alerts in the subscription" -Enabled "True" -AlertProcessingRuleType "AddActionGroups" -ActionGroupId "/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId/resourcegroups/MyResourceGroup1/providers/microsoft.insights/actiongroups/ActionGroup1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet creates an alert processing rule that adds an action group to all alerts in a resource group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-AzAlertProcessingRule -ResourceGroupName "test-rg" -Name "AddActionGroupsBySeverity" -Scope "/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId" -Description "Add AGId1 and AGId2 to all Sev0 and Sev1 alerts in these resourceGroups" -Enabled "True" -AlertProcessingRuleType "AddActionGroups" -ActionGroupId "/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId/resourcegroups/MyResourceGroup1/providers/microsoft.insights/actiongroups/ActionGroup1,/subscriptions/MySubscriptionId/resourceGroups/MyResourceGroup2/providers/microsoft.insights/actionGroups/MyActionGroup2" -FilterMonitorCondition "Equals:Sev0,Sev1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet creates a rule that adds two action groups to all Sev0 and Sev1 alerts
